Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Nisin(1-22) (fragment of nisin A, Synthetic AMPs, UCSS1b)
Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, lantibiotic, bacteria-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (72.73%) toCesin AActivity:  Active against L. lactis MG1363 (MIC 1.28 ug/ml), L. monocytogenes LMG10470 or TT82E or  LK132 (MIC 10.25-41 ug/ml), B-cereus CH-85 (MIC >41 ug/ml), S. aureus LMG10147 or LMG15975 MRSA (MIC 20.5 ug/ml), E. faecium LMG11423 (MIC 41 ug/ml), E-faecium LMG16003 VRE (MIC>41 ug/ml), E-faecalis LMG16216 VRE (MIC >41 ug/ml).
Literature Information.Author: Guo L, Wambui J, Wang C, Muchaamba F, Fernandez-Cantos MV, Broos J, Tasara T, Kuipers OP, Stephan R.2023
Literature Information.Title: Cesin, a short natural variant of nisin, displays potent antimicrobial activity against major pathogens despite lacking two C-terminal macrocycles.
